definitions: An order of dinosaurs, characterized by a lizard-like pelvis, typically bipedal, and including both carnivorous (theropods) and herbivorous (sauropods) forms.
examples: Saurischia includes well-known groups like the Tyrannosaurus and Brontosaurus.
The classification of dinosaurs into Saurischia and Ornithischia is based on pelvic structure.
Many large, long-necked dinosaurs belong to Saurischia.
